definition: To express an idea or feeling fluently and coherently.
To work jointly on an activity or project.
To review or analyse something in a detailed and constructive manner.
To discuss a topic in a formal manner with opposing arguments.
To succeed in understanding, interpreting, or identifying something complex.
To derive as a conclusion from something known or assumed; infer.
To develop or present a theory, policy, or system in further detail.
To understand and share the feelings of another.
To intensify, increase, or further improve the quality, value, or extent of something.
To imagine as a future possibility; visualise.
To infer or estimate by extending or projecting known information.
To make an action or process easy or easier.
To encourage the development of something (especially something desirable).
To put a decision, plan, agreement, etc., into effect.
To make changes in something established, especially by introducing new methods, ideas, or products.
To combine (one thing) with another to form a whole.
To explain the meaning of information, words, or actions.
To try to reach an agreement or compromise by discussion with others.
To become aware or conscious of something; come to realise or understand.
To restore friendly relations between; settle a disagreement.
To remove impurities or unwanted elements from a substance, typically as part of an industrial process.
To form a theory or conjecture about a subject without firm evidence.
To form a theory or set of theories about something.
To lessen the effectiveness, power, or ability of, especially gradually or insidiously.
To check or prove the validity or accuracy of something.
